Interface UserRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<User,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<User,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<User,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<User,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<User>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<User,Long>
public interface UserRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<User,Long>
Repository interface for User entities. Provides CRUD operations and custom queries for user management.
Since:
2025-10-26
Version:
1.0
Author:
Venkatesh K

  • Method Details

    • findByUniversityEmail

      Optional<User> findByUniversityEmail(String email)
      Finds a user by their university email address.
      Parameters:
      email - The university email address to search for
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the user if found, or empty if not found

    • existsByUniversityEmail

      Boolean existsByUniversityEmail(String email)
      Checks if a user with the given university email exists.
      Parameters:
      email - The university email address to check
      Returns:
      true if a user with the email exists, false otherwise

    • existsByIdAndExperiencesId

      @Query(" SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(e) > 0\n THEN true ELSE false END\n FROM User u\n JOIN u.experiences e\n WHERE u.id = :userId\n AND e.id = :experienceId\n") boolean existsByIdAndExperiencesId(@Param("userId") Long userId, @Param("experienceId") Long experienceId)
      Checks if a specific experience belongs to a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user
      experienceId - The ID of the experience to check
      Returns:
      true if the experience belongs to the user, false otherwise

    • existsByUniversityEmailAndExperiencesId

      @Query(" SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(e) > 0\n THEN true ELSE false END\n FROM User u\n JOIN u.experiences e\n WHERE u.universityEmail = :email\n AND e.id = :experienceId\n") boolean existsByUniversityEmailAndExperiencesId(@Param("email") String email, @Param("experienceId") Long experienceId)
      Checks if a specific experience belongs to the user with the given email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user
      experienceId - The ID of the experience to check
      Returns:
      true if the experience belongs to the user, false otherwise
